meanings.definition: A chemical substance that neutralizes alkalis, dissolves some metals, and turns litmus red.
meanings.sent1: The scientist poured the acid into the beaker to conduct the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The acid in the battery helps power the car.
meanings.sent3: The acid and the base decided to have a neutralizing party.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like acid, burning through his defenses.
meanings.sent5: The acid rain corroded the metal statue over time.

meanings.sent1: She made a face after tasting the acid lemon juice.
meanings.sent2: The vinegar had an acid taste that made her pucker.
meanings.sent3: The acid candy made him scrunch up his nose in surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her sarcastic remarks had an acid effect on the mood of the room.
meanings.sent5: The sour acid flavor lingered on his tongue after eating the grapefruit.
